subject: Re: [junit] SimpleTest allways appears
msgSnippet: ... The content of this list is stored into the file .junitsession in the home directory (the home directory depends on your system, on win2k, it s in
messageBody:
> Why does the junit.samples.SimpleTest appear in my list of tests to run,
> even though I've deleted the class files from my classpath? When I
> click the "..." button, it does not show up, but it does in the drop
> down list.


The content of this list is stored into the file '.junitsession' in the
'home' directory (the home directory depends on your system, on win2k,
it's in 'c:\Documents and Settings\username').

The list only stores the last 5 tests selected, so the
'junit.samples.SimpleTest' should be deleted after you have selected and
successfully run several other tests.

for those interested, the code is located in the file
'junit.swingui.TestRunner.java', line 520.

-Vladimir

PS: don't thank me with a mail to the entire list :-)
